definitions.definition: vibrations that travel through the air or another medium and can be heard when they reach a person's or animal's ear.
examples: light travels faster than sound

definitions.definition: a thing that can be heard.
examples: plural noun: sounds

definitions.definition: the area or distance within which something can be heard.
examples: we were always within sound of the train whistles

definitions.definition: sound produced by continuous and regular vibrations, as opposed to noise.
short for speech sound.
examples: utterance, cry, word, noise, peep she did not make a sound

definitions.definition: music, speech, and sound effects when recorded, used to accompany a film or video production, or broadcast.
examples: a sound studio

definitions.definition: broadcasting by radio as distinct from television.
the distinctive quality of the music of a particular composer or performer or of the sound produced by a particular musical instrument.
examples: the sound of the Beatles

definitions.definition: music, especially popular music.
examples: plural noun: sounds

definitions.definition: the ideas or impressions conveyed by words.
examples: you've had a hard day, by the sound of it
synonyms: description "I don't like the sound of that"

definitions.definition: emit or cause to emit sound.
examples: a loud buzzer sounded
synonyms: set off; ring "drivers must sound their horns"

definitions.definition: give an audible signal to indicate (something).
examples: a different bell begins to sound midnight

definitions.definition: express or convey (a warning).
examples: pharmaceutical companies are sounding the alarm about counterfeit drugs

definitions.definition: test (the lungs or another body cavity) by noting the sound they produce.
examples: the doctor sounded her chest

definitions.definition: convey a specified impression when heard.
examples: he sounded worried

definitions.definition: (of something or someone that has been described to one) convey a specified impression.
examples: it sounds as though you really do believe that
synonyms: come across as "it sounds like a crazy idea"

definitions.definition: in good condition; not damaged, injured, or diseased.
examples: they returned safe and sound

definitions.definition: based on reason, sense, or judgment.
examples: sound advice for healthy living

definitions.definition: competent, reliable, or holding acceptable views.
examples: he's a bit stuffy, but he's very sound on his law

definitions.definition: financially secure.
examples: she could get her business on a sound footing for the first time

definitions.definition: (of sleep) deep and undisturbed.
examples: deep, undisturbed, uninterrupted, untroubled, peaceful a sound sleep

definitions.definition: (of a person) tending to sleep deeply.
examples: I am a sound sleeper

definitions.definition: severe.
examples: such people should be given a sound thrashing

definitions.definition: soundly.
examples: he was sound asleep

definitions.definition: ascertain (the depth of water), typically by means of a line or pole or using sound echoes.
examples: measure, gauge, determine, test, investigate, survey, plumb, fathom, probe sound the depth of the river

definitions.definition: examine (a person's bladder or other internal cavity) with a long surgical probe.
question (someone), typically in a cautious or discreet way, as to their opinions or feelings on a subject.
examples: we'll sound out our representatives first
synonyms: sample; informalpump "if you'll just sound them out

definitions.definition: inquire into (someone's opinions of feelings) in a cautious way.
examples: officials arrived to sound out public opinion at meetings in factories
synonyms: sample; informalpump "if you'll just sound them out

definitions.definition: (especially of a whale) dive down steeply to a great depth.
a long surgical probe, typically with a curved, blunt end.
a narrow stretch of water forming an inlet or connecting two wider areas of water such as two seas or a sea and a lake.
examples: channel, (sea) passage, strait(s), narrows, waterway; Moreinlet, arm (of the sea), fjord, creek, bay; estuary "an oil spill in the sound"Moreinlet, arm (of the sea), fjord, creek, bay; estuary an oil spill in the sound
